definition: intercalary month in the lunar calendar/leap month
intercalary/an extra day or month inserted into the lunar or solar calendar (such as February 29)

sentences.english: Determines whether the specified month is a leap month.
sentences.chinese: 確定指定的月份是否爲閏月。

sentences.english: Calculates the leap month for a specified year.
sentences.chinese: 計算指定紀元年份的閏月。

sentences.english: When overridden in a derived class, determines whether a month is a leap month.
sentences.chinese: 在衍生類別覆寫時，判斷某個月份是否爲閏月。

sentences.english: Calculates the leap month for a specified year and era.
sentences.chinese: 計算指定年份和紀元的閏月。

sentences.english: This recurring appointment begins on a leap year.
sentences.chinese: 您的定期約會開始日期是閏月日期。

definition: old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]
the triennial provincial imperial exam during the Ming and Qing
5-7 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
Jingshan county in Jingmen 荊門|荆门[Jing1 men2], Hubei
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
3-5 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
Dragon Boat Festival (the 5th day of the 5th lunar month)
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
